column1: steps
In a medium bowl, whisk the vinegar with the sugar, thyme, and 1/4 cup of the oil; season with salt and pepper
BREAK0
Put the potatoes and garlic in a pot and cover with water; season with salt and bring to a boil
Simmer over moderate heat until the potatoes are tender, 10 minutes
BREAK1
Drain and thinly slice the potatoes
BREAK2
Add to the dressing and toss
Discard the garlic
BREAK3
Put the flour, eggs, and panko in three separate shallow bowls
Season the pork with salt and pepper and dip in the flour
BREAK4
Dip the cutlets in the egg and then in the panko
BREAK5
Press to help the crumbs adhere
BREAK6
In a large skillet, heat 1/2 inch of oil until shimmering
Add the cutlets in a single layer and cook over high heat, turning once
BREAK7
Cook until golden and crispy, about 3 minutes
Drain on paper towels
BREAK8
Add the parsley to the skillet and cook, stirring, until crisp, about 30 seconds
Using a slotted spoon, transfer the parsley to a paper towel\u2013lined plate and sprinkle with salt
BREAK9
Serve the pork with the potato salad
Garnish with the parsley
BREAK10
